Sentencas: The spinel structure of manganese cobalt oxide (Mn,Co)(3)O-4 is one of the most promising coatings for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) stainless steel interconnects.
Titulo: Studies on elements diffusion of Mn/Co coated ferritic stainless steel for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects application

Sentencas: The stoichiometric Mn1.5Co1.5O4 composition has properties that are preferable to other Mn/Co ratios, for example a higher conductivity and a thermal expansion coefficient that matches the typical steel substrate.
Titulo: Studies on elements diffusion of Mn/Co coated ferritic stainless steel for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects application

Sentencas: However, previous work showed the Mn/Co ratio changes during operation due to the diffusion of Mn from the substrate.
Titulo: Studies on elements diffusion of Mn/Co coated ferritic stainless steel for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects application

Sentencas: The results presented here are on three coatings with different compositions (namely; pure Co, Mn20Co80, and Mn40Co60) with each coating composition deposited to a thickness of 800 nm, 1500 nm, and 3000 nm.
Titulo: Studies on elements diffusion of Mn/Co coated ferritic stainless steel for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects application

Sentencas: The coatings were applied by DC magnetron sputtering and then machine cut into coupons for isothermal annealing at 800 degrees C in air using a batch-type furnace for 2, 10, 50, 250, and 1000 h. The morphology, chemical composition (including surface and cross sections of the layers) and structures of the oxides formed were analyzed by SEM, EDS and XRD.
Titulo: Studies on elements diffusion of Mn/Co coated ferritic stainless steel for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects application

Sentencas: Analysis of the element diffusion (Mn, Co, Cr, Fe) shown here points to an optimized coating recipe of Mn40Co60.
Titulo: Studies on elements diffusion of Mn/Co coated ferritic stainless steel for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects application
